alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:47PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Kimball and south central Banner Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 647 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Kimball Airport, or over Kimball, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Dix, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 11 and 30. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
